description: Conversion of residential building into six self - contained units, two storey side extension (as viewed from the front elevation) three storey side and part rear extension (as viewed from the rear elevation), external alterations and excavation of part of the garden to enable changes in internal floor areas and a sunken patio, with accomadation in the roof space. The proposal incorporates Juliet balconies on the rear elevation and a roof terrace; refuse storage and cycle parking
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Prior to the commencement of development, including any initial clearance, the protective fencing and other protection measures specified by the Tree survey, Arboricultural Implications Assessment, Arboricultural Method statement and Tree Protection Plan (ref. CC/163/AR354, dated 28th July 2008, produced by Challice Consulting Ltd) shall be erected in locations agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and shall be maintained fully intact and (in the case of the fencing) upright, in its approved locations at all times, until the completion of all building operations on the site (unless agreed otherwise in writing by the Local Planning Authority).  Where phased protection measures have been approved, no works shall commence on the next phase of the development until the protective fencing barriers and other protective measures have been repositioned for that phase in full accordance with the approved details. No activity of any description must occur at any time within these areas including but not restricted to the following:     a)	No mixing of cement or any other materials. b)	Storage or disposal of any soil, building materials, rubble, machinery, fuel, chemicals, liquids waste residues or materials/debris of any other description. c)	Siting of any temporary structures of any description including site office/sales buildings, temporary car parking facilities, porta loos, storage compounds or hard standing areas of any other description. d)	Soil/turf stripping, raising/lowering of existing levels, excavation or alterations to the existing surfaces/ ground conditions of any other description. e)	Installation/siting of any underground services, temporary or otherwise including; drainage, water, gas, electricity, telephone, television, external lighting or any associated ducting. f)	Parking/use of tracked or wheeled machinery or vehicles of any description.  No fires shall be lit within 20 metres of the trunks of any trees or the centre line of any hedgerow shown to be retained.  No signs, cables, fixtures or fittings of any other description shall be attached to any part of any retained tree.   REASON: In order to safeguard trees and other vegetation considered to be worthy of retention in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and biodiversity, and in accordance with policy 4.5 of the Council's Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment', 2004. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, the residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, prior to first occupation and thereafter retained, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: Accessible Ealing. | Prior to the commencement of any earth works on site, a contaminated land investigation shall be carried out to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority, and any removal, neutralising or sealing works, and remediation works identified as necessary shall be undertaken as agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any other works.  Reason: In the interests of health and safety, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details of the approved plans and unless otherwise agreed in writing the development shall be constructed in accordance with the requirements of Secure By Design and all security measures shall be installed prior to the occupation of the development and retained thereafter.  Reason: In the interest of the safety of occupiers of the development, in accordance policy 4.4 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8. | Notwithstanding the approved plans and prior to the installation of window W22 (show on drawings GPR-068/08 andrew DWG no. 3 of 8 revision G and GPR-068/08 andrew DWG no. 6 of 8 revision H), details shall be submitted with regards to the size and positioning of window W22,  providing adequate separation to the rendered section directly below it.  Such details shall be agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority and implemented as agreed.  Reason: To ensure that the new window is sympathetic to the design and appearance of the existing and altered building, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment', 2004. | Notwithstanding the approved plans and prior to the completion of the development, details of the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatments, and details of landscaping including a landscape management plan for communal areas (including the communal roof terrace), shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The boundary treatments and landscaping shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the management plan shall be implemented as agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, for a time period of five years, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the appearance and provide security, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment', 2004. | Prior to the occupation of the development the lower panes of window W17, shown on drawings GPR-068/08 andrew DWG no. 2 of 8 revision G and GPR-068/08 andrew DWG no. 6 of 8 revision H shall be fitted with obscure glass, which shall thereafter be retained.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of occupiers of no. 180 Southfield Road, and in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment', 2004. | Notwithstanding the details of the approved plans, details of all external materials to be used in the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of visual amenity and in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment', 2004. | Details of sound attenuation measures from traffic and air traffic noise together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential development shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residenital units and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, and in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment', 2004, and to Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, 'Noise and Vibration'. | Details of refuse storage (including provisions for recycling) in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be installed and implemented prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To safeguard the living and working conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interest of the environment, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | Cycle parking shall be implemented as per the approved drawing GPR-068/08 andrew DWG. No. 1 of 8 Revision G (received 16/10/2008) and retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that adequate provision is made for the cycle parking, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 9.6 of the of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
